message: Well, Amazon SQS uses SOAP. No longer excited to write a module therefor.
Reed and I are trying to write some KRL that uses SOAP web services from BYU. Nasty stuff. If you have any ideas, let us know.
How generic do you think such a service could be? Could it handle any SOAP calls or would it be tied to one particular service or family of services?
I was just going to ask if you thought it worth my time.
Yeah, you'd need something to translate it from SOAP to what KRL can handle
You can imagine what it would look like to go the other way around.
https://github.com/snay2/cs462server
SOAP tends to need a lot of specificity. My guess is that you couldn't make it general at all
The Kynetx apps they wrote in 462 could add the URL of that script as a datasource and then pull in messages as JSON like normal
Would you use some kind of SOAP translation service?
But I've avoided SOAP whenever humanly possible, so I couldn't tell you for sure
For SQS probably not. In Phil's 462 class I wrote a server-side shim (in Python) to expose SQS to the Kynetx apps the students had to write.
Guess I'm thinking something similar to Yahoo Query Language.
Snap, that's what I was afraid of.
The handy thing with AWS, though, is that it's easy to build a server-side shim since your language of choice probably has an AWS library already
Yeah, that's a good  point.
Let me see if I can dig out the code I wrote for CS 462 and put it on Github. Then you can see what I mean.
That would be very helpful. If it's not too much trouble please do.
Right now there's just one file. It reads messages from the SQS queue and returns a JSON object containing the body of the message
Sounds like just what I am looking for. Thanks!
if there is not too much security involved you can also make soap calls in javascript
from the browser
or with YQL or nodejs on the server side
if your soap api is not too complicated it could be done in KRL too I believe
https://wingcash.com/usd/w002-5a79-24e3-2f99
http://pub.fairewing.com/note-k.png
can I buy something to eat with those notes?
See https://convore.com/wingcash/hungry/
On the other hand, I just used KRL to create an SNS topic.
